required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: IV Acetaminophen for Postoperative Pain After Pelvic Organ Prolapse Repair
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of IV Acetaminophen on Postoperative Pain in Women Undergoing Pelvic Organ Prolapse Repair: A Double-Blind Randomized Placebo Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether preoperative IV Acetaminophen reduces postoperative pain and narcotic consumption in women undergoing surgical repair of pelvic organ prolapse.

detailed_description.textblock: This randomized controlled trial of IV Acetaminophen compared to placebo will evaluate the effect of preoperative IV Acetaminophen on postoperative pain scores and narcotic requirements in women undergoing surgical repair of pelvic organ prolapse. 204 women will randomly receive 1000 mg of IV Acetaminophen or saline preoperatively within 30 minutes of surgical incision. Subjects will be offered narcotic and non-narcotic pain medications as needed during the postoperative period. Visual analogue pain scales (VAS) will be obtained at 4, 8, 12, 16, 20 and 24 hours postoperatively. Narcotic consumption will be recorded in morphine-equivalents. We hypothesize that women receiving IV Acetaminophen will have lower VAS scores and decreased narcotic requirements compared to controls.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Postoperative Pain
primary_outcome.description: Post operative pain will be assessed at baseline, 4, 8, 12, 16, 20 and 24 hours after surgery. Pain will be self reported by VAS pain scales which range from 0-100mm.
Equianalgesic dosage tables will be used to convert intra- and postoperative narcotics into morphine equivalents to compare narcotic requirements for the first week after surgery.

secondary_outcome.description: To determine the impact of pain control on satisfaction and mood, subjects will be asked to complete the American Pain Society Patient Outcome Questionnaire (APS-POQ-R) on postoperative day (POD) #1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Interference of pain with physical, mental and social activities
secondary_outcome.description: Interference of pain with physical, mental and social activities will be measured by the Patient Reported Outcomes Measures Information Systems-Pain Interference-Short Form 8a (PROMIS PI-SF-8a) administered on POD#7.

Postoperative nausea, pruritus, dizziness and drowsiness will be assessed using the APS-POQ-R questionnaire administered on POD#1. Constipation and time to first bowel movement will be measured with postoperative bowel diaries and the Bristol Stool Scale.

arm_group.description: 100 cc of normal saline administered intravenously 10-30 minutes prior to anesthesia induction on the day of surgery.
100 cc of Acetaminophen (1000mg/100mL) administered intravenously 10-30 minutes prior to anesthesia induction on the day of surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women ≥ 18 years of age
- scheduled to undergo surgery for POP via a vaginal or minimally invasive (laparoscopic/robotic) route at the University of Pittsburgh Medical Center
- women anticipated to have a hospital stay ≥24 hours
Exclusion Criteria:
- allergy/intolerance to acetaminophen
- hepatic dysfunction
- significant alcohol use - defined as patient reported consumption of more than 7 standard drinks per week and/or 3 drinks per day

facility.name: Magee-Womens Hospital of the University of Pittsburgh Medical Center
